creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
2 poems(kyo_ka)

right:To a man
Sending a love note, Even the swift messanger
Seems slow as a duck
Stuck on birdline.
(Tsukebumi no
Tsukai mono ni wa
Chi wo hashiru
Koi no yakko mo
Kamo no torimochi)
by Ho_nen Yukimaru

left:When you and I
Go into the next life, Let us perch
Like kingfisher wing to wing.
(Kimi no waga
Nochi no yo kakete
Hasu no ha ni
Ii kawasemi no
Hane wo naraben)
by Sandara Ho_shi
markings: 2(no.2) written on the upper left corner; meaning unknown
medium: From a woodblock printed book, ink and color on paper
portfolio: Myriad Birds: Kyōka Comparisons (Momo chidori kyōka awase 百千鳥狂歌合)
title: Mallards and a Kingfisher
